title: I didn't know I was gonna get "The Hands," Darius

embed.description: Playing ranked, im fiddlesticks, i just successfully counter jungled Hecarim (kappa) then he started to chase me and so Darius followed in the pursuit from toplane, long story short Darius pull is broken.

body: Considering the recent changes to Darius, I would say he's a bit more balanced now, and by no means un-counterable per se. But considering how easily it is to engage as Darius, one laning with him wouldn't be stupid enough to get juked and pulled...right? Well in some cases this just doesn't matter - his E range is considerably misleading (to user and opponent). Maining Darius toplane (an incredible feat, I know) last season I found that I would land more hooks more often than not and think 'I really shouldn't have landed that'. My point being, Darius' E, Apprehend, is represented poorly, to both the user and the opponent. I would like to debate on _**either shortening the actual pull gradient to the targeted area it actually represents, or lengthening the target area to represent the actual pull range**_. (The above link representing a clear exaggeration, but still funny and relevant - please dont comment on the events of the video, rather, your experiences regarding being questionably pulled)

The problem isn't the range or representation of Darius' pull, it's just the way it's coded.
